metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6816 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The code in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M11, 8.5.0 to 8.5.6, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.38, 7.0.0 to 7.0.72, and 6.0.0 to 6.0.47 that parsed the HTTP request line permitted invalid characters. This could be exploited, in conjunction with a proxy that also permitted the invalid characters but with a different interpretation, to inject data into the HTTP response. By manipulating the HTTP response the attacker could poison a web-cache, perform an XSS attack and/or obtain sensitive information from requests other then their own.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3').
